document.title: The Discourses
document.paragraph: He is free who lives as he wishes to live; who is neither subject to compulsion nor to hindrance, nor to force; whose movement to action are not impeded, whose desires attain their purpose, and who dose not fall into that which he would avoid.

Do we then find any of the bad free from sorrow, free from fear, who does not fall into that which he would avoid, and does not obtain that which he wishes? Not one; nor then do we find ant bad man free.
